choices.A: Deploy two u-6tb1.56xlarge EC2 instances for SAP HANA in separate AWS Regions. Set up synchronous SAP HANA system replication between the instances.
choices.D: Deploy two u-6tb1.56xlarge EC2 instances for SAP HANA in separate Availability Zones in the same AWS Region. Set up asynchronous SAP HANA system replication between the instances.
choices.C: Deploy two u-6tb1.56xlarge EC2 instances for SAP HANA in separate Availability Zones in the same AWS Region. Set up synchronous SAP HANA system replication between the instances.
choices.B: Deploy two u-6tb1.56xlarge EC2 instances for SAP HANA in separate AWS Regions. Set up asynchronous SAP HANA system replication between the instances.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
...synchronous...rpo of near zero needed....

Selected Answer: C
C: To meet the requirement of a near-zero RPO (Recovery Point Objective) and the lowest possible RTO (Recovery Time Objective), you should set up synchronous SAP HANA system replication. Synchronous replication ensures that data is written to the primary and secondary database simultaneously, providing near-zero RPO.

Having the instances in separate Availability Zones within the same AWS region ensures high availability and fault tolerance without the latencies that would be incurred if the instances were in separate regions.

Selected Answer: C
C 

Think about HIGH latency when deploying multi-region
I think its C.

questions.question_text:
A company wants to deploy SAP BW/4HANA on AWS. An SAP technical architect selects a u-6tb1.56xlarge Amazon EC2 instance to host the SAP HANA database. The SAP technical architect must design a highly available architecture that achieves the lowest possible RTO and a near-zero RPO. The solution must not affect the performance of the primary database.

Which solution will meet these requirements?

discussion.content: D is the right one.

Selected Answer: D
D: To receive full support from both SAP and AWS for SAP workloads running on AWS, it is necessary to have the AWS Data Provider for SAP agent configured and running. This agent collects performance data from the AWS infrastructure and makes it available to SAP applications for SAP's support and services.

Selected Answer: D
Data provider

Selected Answer: D
AWS Data Provider for SAP agent is configured

choices.C: Ensure that the /usr/sap file system is running on local instance storage.
choices.A: Purchase an AWS Developer Support plan.
choices.D: Ensure that the AWS Data Provider for SAP agent is configured and running.
choices.B: Turn on Amazon CloudWatch basic monitoring.

questions.question_text:
A company has migrated its SAP workloads to AWS. A third-party team performs a technical evaluation and finds that the SAP workloads are not fully supported by SAP and AWS.

What should the company do to receive full support from SAP and AWS?

A company wants to run SAP HANA on AWS in the eu-central-1 Region. The company must make the SAP HANA system highly available by using SAP HANA system replication. In addition, the company must create a disaster recovery (DR) solution that uses SAP HANA system replication in the eu-west-1 Region. As prerequisites, the company has confirmed that Inter-AZ latency is less than 1 ms and that Inter-Region latency is greater than 1 ms.
Which solutions will meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Iâ€˜d discard B only as SYNC replication is not apt for cross region with > 1 ms latency,
the other options look feasible

Selected Answer: BE
B and E

Selected Answer: BE
B and E are right answers.

Selected Answer: BC
Voting B,C

Selected Answer: BE
B and E

Selected Answer: BE
B E will work
Agree with BE

Selected Answer: BE
Agree with BE

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sap/latest/sap-hana/hana-ops-patterns-multi.html

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sap/latest/sap-hana/sap-hana-on-aws-aws-infrastructure-operating-system-setup-and-hana-installation.html

Selected Answer: BE
I think B and E.
The problem statement says that HANA system replication is used for both high availability and DR. Therefore, for High Availability, it would be SYNC replication mode or SYNCMEM replication mode, and for DR, it would be ASYNC replication mode. So, the answer is B and E.
Option C does not use HANA system replication in DR.

Selected Answer: BC
I think B and C

choices.A: Install the tier 1 primary system and the tier 2 secondary system in eu-central-1. Configure the tier 1 system in Availability Zone 1. Configure the tier 2 system in Availability Zone 2. Configure SAP HANA system replication between tier 1 and tier 2 by using ASYNC replication mode. Install the DR tier 3 secondary system in eu-west-1 by using SYNC replication mode.
choices.D: Install the tier 1 primary system in eu-central-1. Install the tier 2 secondary system and the DR tier 3 secondary system in eu-west-1. Configure the tier 2 system in Availability Zone 1. Configure the tier 3 system in Availability Zone 2. Configure SAP HANA system replication between all tiers by using ASYNC replication mode.
choices.E: Install the tier 1 primary system and the tier 2 secondary system in eu-central-1. Configure the tier 1 system in Availability Zone 1. Configure the tier 2 system in Availability Zone 2. Configure SAP HANA system replication between tier 1 and tier 2 by using SYNCMEM replication mode. Install the DR tier 3 secondary system in eu-west-1 by using ASYNC replication mode.
choices.B: Install the tier 1 primary system and the tier 2 secondary system in eu-central-1. Configure the tier 1 system in Availability Zone 1. Configure the tier 2 system in Availability Zone 2. Configure SAP HANA system replication between tier 1 and tier 2 by using SYNC replication mode. Install the DR tier 3 secondary system in eu-west-1 by using ASYNC replication mode.
choices.C: Install the tier 1 primary system and the tier 2 secondary system in eu-central-1. Configure the tier 1 system in Availability Zone 1. Configure the tier 2 system in Availability Zone 2. Configure SAP HANA system replication between tier 1 and tier 2 by using SYNC replication mode. Install the DR tier 3 secondary system in eu-west-1. Store daily backups from tier 1 in an Amazon S3 bucket in eu-central-1. Use S3 Cross-Region Replication to copy the daily backups to eu-west-1, where they can be restored if needed.

questions.question_text:
A company has run SAP HANA on AWS for a few years on an Amazon EC2 X1 instance with dedicated tenancy. Because of business growth, the company plans to migrate to an EC2 High Memory instance by using a resize operation. The SAP HANA system is set up for high availability with SAP HANA system replication and clustering software.

Which combination of steps should the company take before the migration? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AEF
Should be AEF.

B incorrect as we usually avoid changing IP addresses to avoid complications and confusion.
C incorrect as we should analyse if there is a need to adjust the size before the migration instead of adjusting it.
D is not the correct step to prepare for migration. It is not a practice to resize an instance before the migration.

Selected Answer: ADE
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sap/latest/sap-hana/migrating-hana-to-hm.html

Selected Answer: ADE
Correct are A, D and E.

Option A is correct because the source system must be running on a supported operating system version before migrating to an EC2 High Memory instance.

Option D is correct because the you should resize the instance through the AWS Management Console or the AWS CLI.

Option E is correct because there should be a backup of the source system before migrating to an EC2 High Memory instance.

Adjusting the storage size of SAP HANA data, log, shared, and backup volumes is not required as it is automatically adjusted when you resize the instance. Updating all references to the IP address of the source system including the /etc/hosts file for the operating system and DNS entries to reflect the new IP address is not required as there is no change in IP address when resizing an instance.3 Updating DNS records and checking connectivity between SAP application servers and the new SAP HANA instance are not necessary as there is no change in IP address when resizing an instance.
I think it's CDE
my answer would be ADE

choices.A: Ensure that the source system is running on a supported operating system version.
choices.C: Adjust the storage size of SAP HANA data, log, shared, and backup volumes.
choices.E: Ensure that there is a backup of the source system.
choices.D: Resize the instance through the AWS Management Console or the AWS CLI.
choices.F: Update the DNS records. Check the connectivity between the SAP application servers and the new SAP HANA instance.
choices.B: Update all references to the IP address of the source system, including the /etc/hosts file for the operating system and DNS entries, to reflect the new IP address.
Use AWS CloudTrail to check the CPU utilization metric. Set up an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic to send the notification.
choices.A: Create an AWS Lambda function that checks CPU utilization and sends the notification.
choices.D: Use the Amazon CloudWatch dashboard to monitor CPU utilization. Set up an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic to send the notification.
choices.C: Use Amazon CloudWatch to set a CPU utilization alarm. Set up an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic to send the notification.

questions.question_text:
A company is migrating a 20 TB SAP S/4HANA system to AWS. The company wants continuous monitoring of the SAP S/4HANA system and wants to receive notification when CPU utilization is greater than 90%. An SAP solutions architect must implement a solution that provides this notification with the least possible effort.

Which solution meets these requirements?

discussion.content: answer is C

Selected Answer: C
Voting C

Selected Answer: C
C: Amazon CloudWatch can be used to monitor the CPU utilization of your instances and can send alarms when certain thresholds, like 90% utilization, are reached. You can set up Amazon SNS to send notifications when these alarms are triggered.

Selected Answer: C
Voting C

Selected Answer: C
The correct one is C

exam.name: AWS Certified SAP on AWS - Specialty PAS-C01
